javadoc:
A High-level variable (as in a high-level language like C/C++)
 built out of Varnodes (low-level variables).  This is a base-class

methods.javadoc: Link Varnodes directly to this HighVariable
methods.name: setHighOnInstances
methods.comment: Link Varnodes directly to this HighVariable

methods.javadoc: @return the high function associated with this variable.
methods.name: getHighFunction

return.comment: the high function associated with this variable.

methods.javadoc: @return get the name of the variable
methods.name: getName

return.comment: get the name of the variable

methods.javadoc: @return get the size of the variable
methods.name: getSize

return.comment: get the size of the variable

methods.javadoc: @return get the data type attached to the variable
methods.name: getDataType

return.comment: get the data type attached to the variable

methods.javadoc: @return get the varnode that represents this variable
methods.name: getRepresentative

return.comment: get the varnode that represents this variable

methods.name: getInstances
methods.comment:
A variable can reside in different locations at various times.
 Get all the instances of the variable.

methods.name: attachInstances
methods.comment: Attach an instance or additional location the variable can be found in.

params.name: rep
params.comment: location that variable comes into scope.

name: HighVariable
comment:
A High-level variable (as in a high-level language like C/C++)
 built out of Varnodes (low-level variables).  This is a base-class
